messages.title: Labour's pledges to you
messages.content:
We will provide an additional £8 billion over the lifetime of the next Parliament for social care.
We will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour and give all workers full rights from day one.
We will set up a National Education Service to provide cradle-to-grave learning that is free at the point of use from early years to adult education.
We will set up a National Investment Bank and regional development banks - including a Bank of the North - to fund major capital projects and finance growth and good jobs.
All of our manifesto commitments are fully costed. We promise no tax rises for those earning below £80,000 a year - that's 95% of all earners.

community.content: Extensive flooding that had a devastating impact on a number of residents and businesses. We’ll maintain the triple lock on state pension, compensate women affected by the increase in the pension age, and protect free bus passes.

leaflet.personalStatement: As a medical scientist, I work in partnership with NHS doctors to develop new treatments for disabling medical conditions. Labour is the party that rebuilt this nation after the War - we established the NHS with free health care for all. I saw at first-hand the dedicated care that NHS staff gave my late father as he lived with cancer. But under the Tories, the NHS has been pushed into a state of crisis, with patients enduring long waits on trolleys in hospital corridors.

endorsements.endorsement: I will be voting for Steve because he understands the value of the jobs in the manufacturing industry. He will fight for investment in colleges to give companies their next intake of apprentices and.
An intelligent, capable, caring person who has common sense on the issues I believe really matter, like adequate funding for the NHS and welfare, and the future of our education system.
I endorse Steve Clapcote as the Labour candidate for Shipley because he is committed to keeping the triple lock on pensions and recognising the needs of all age groups.
